message: Coolio. That's the future of video games in Vancouver right there.
Social, mobile and casual gaming.
Probably right?
That's a bit OT
but ok
It's just a matter of time
The mainstream are taking our esoteric interest away from us and we're killing it from the inside.
Isn't that what they are already doing?
they/we
There's also A Thinking Ape, which is/was YCombinator funded
My friend Kate got a job at Blitzoo Vancouver
new company doing facebook/social games
maybe!
I started a build. Let's play street fighter
They'll be done as soon as BApe see their logo.
Should the traditional industry double down on games where you shoot terrorists/aliens in the face?
no at all, check out www.athinkingape.com
tavis, I just left Blitzoo last week. Tell Kate I said hello.

I don't think its doomed, just that its a really hard industry to get into with little experience. My brother tried applying for 2 years. They just wanted more experience even with his degree in programming.
The problem is all the big shops are closing down and so there is an overabundance of talent laid off, with no new places starting up.
The new studio from Microsoft and possibly Square Enix opening up in Vancouver are really the only glimmers of hope Vancouver gaming has had in a really long time.
